captions.text:
00:03
COMM: The picture of true bliss, this two

week old puppy enjoys a relaxing bath. And
he’s so laid back, he almost falls asleep

00:13
COMM: The clean canine was filmed by Claire

Fowler, a volunteer at the DFW Rescue Me animal
shelter in Dallas, Texas

00:21
Claire: The reason why I filmed giving this
little guy a bath was because he was so content.

00:27
Claire: I really like to document the puppies

as they grow, especially with bottle babies,
and he was just falling asleep so I had to
capture that moment.

00:37
Claire: Our organisation DFW Rescue Me save

dogs from local animal shelters are about
to be euthanised or abandoned, neglected or
abusive intuitions.

00:47
Claire: We got a call from Dallas Animal Services

and there were three puppies that were abandoned
in a bag that were found outside a dumpster
in Dallas, Texas.

00:55
COMM: And with no mum around, these tiny dogs

take plenty of looking after, so Claire took
them home.

01:01
Claire: What people don't realise is that

bottle babies require a lot of time and special
care.

01:06
Claire: Not only do they have to be bottle

fed every 2 to 4 hours, but they can't go
to the restroom on their own.

01:11
Mum helps them with that and since there's
no mum we do everything here.

01:16
COMM: Keeping the puppies clean is very important,

and this little one really doesn’t seem
to mind at all.

01:22
Claire: I bathe the puppies often since I'm
mum. I've got to make sure they're clean.

01:26
Claire: Since they were found in a dumpster

they were covered in fleas, so we've been
trying to get rid of the fleas since fleaing
them can actually kill puppies quickly.

01:34
Claire: So right now the puppies don't have

names since they're just under two weeks old
and we're thinking about it. Trying to decide
on some strong names for these three.

title: Cute Puppy Shower: Rescued Pup Enjoys Bath Time

comments.author: eelaterp

comments.text:
I agree, the puppy is mighty cute but as cute as these animals may be, 
there are literally millions of human beings living very poorly in the U.S. 
and around the world. America has an obsession with cats and dogs, 
preferring to ignore the mass human suffering around the world. 

The amount of money in food, toys and medical care lavished on pets in the 
Western world is astonishing when you consider how many fellow human beings 
are living in abject poverty and misery. It just seems like escapism to me 
that we lavish so much time, care and money on animals that aren't as 
necessary as they are.

 I believe having a pet is great, but Westerners in particular have more 
pets than any other part of the world. It's not just about having a pet, 
but multiple pets, and it's not just a few people who own them but the 
majority. It just seems that humanity's priorities are seriously misplaced. 
Animals are a joy and they are absolutely wonderful to love and be parts of 
our lives, but we've also forgot that there are literally tens of millions 
of human beings at this moment living lives none of us would want to live 
ourselves.

BUT we've got tens of billions of dollars to blow on fluffy cuteness. Also 
keep in mind that we have turned these pets into dependents (rather than 
taking care of our more serious needs in our society) and there are 
unscrupulous individuals profiting off of breeding these pets at ridiculous 
rates all for profit. Just some food for thought.﻿

I'm appalled at so many of the comments that are left on these videos that 
allow animal lovers to see the rewards some of the lucky critters receive 
by those with big hearts!! The great work that rescue sites & their workers 
provide is rewarded when animal angels come in to adopt a new family 
member. When I read the filth written by some people here, I know why 
animals are so easy to love & think that some of these people could be 
their abusers. Words are abusive!!﻿
